content.description: This fun and easy climb starts sitting just to the left of the bigger of the two trees that sit against Wonder Wall. Starting holds are opposing sidepulls. Go straight up the slab!
content.location: Far left side of Wonder Wall, left of the bigger of the two trees.

content.description: Start in a large right hand pocket and move up through an obvious and nasty sloped pocket before getting to the jugs
Start sitting with a good ledge for your right and a decent pocket for your left. Make a few tough moves and you're on the slab. Guidebook calls it V1, but I think that's a bit of a sandbag.
content.location: Directly to the right of the skinny tree that looks like its attached to the rock.

content.description: Begin on a ledge, move left towards a slopey jug and up onto a short slab
Start on a crimp rail, move towards a small crimp on the right, then go up and to the right through slopers to the finishing jug
Heel hook start / Campus middle / Mantle endOrange line = V2 variation

Heads up, this is a super contrived route with some dumb artificial boundaries, I don’t pretend it’s anything it’s not lmao. It’s still super fun.The line is basically a ledge and some easy holds, so just working around it since you can always just grab them and be done, and that’s no fun.You start matched in the pocket shown in the bottom left of the picture.   Anything below the red line is on, otherwise it’s off.

 A good rule is if it seems too easy, it’s probably off. You’re traversing to the right, not going straight up.  Beta (super specific to avoid aid):

 - Right hand to the pocket on the right- Match left with an undercling-Right hand to sloper-Left hand to hold slightly above the right hand sloper (be careful not to go over the red line on this, ruins the route)- Right hand to shelf, then immediate bump to higher better shelf  -Flag right leg and lift body up- Match right hand-Move feet over right  -There is a good shelf where you end up with both your feet and that’s the end.   Since you can’t get your hands up above the line you end up doing a cool little slab traverse at the end
Short wall that has a tree growing from the base that looks like its attached to the rock.
